page.title: 06Railways 1862-1985 Part 3
page.content: Various schemes were proposed for the line to become a permanent freight route avoiding London, although most of these proposals concentrated on the line west of Sandy. The steam locomotives were replaced by diesel multiple unit trains but traffic did not increase sufficiently and the whole line was put down for closure during the mid-1960's. After much discussion, only the section from Goldington Power Station east of Bedford to Cambridge was closed completely and this took place in 1967. Although the G.N.R. and L.N.W.R. stations were built alongside each other, there was insufficient cooperation and connections were poor. Thus, a chance to increase trade was lost.
